comment.author: 25159926@N00
comment._content: Such an extraordinary image. What an impact it must have had upon the people of Dublin to have seen that.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: And yet it looks as if people are going about their business, cyling to work, etc.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 65361386@N05
comment._content: One of the interesting things about this shot is that you can just make out the fallen flagpole from which the "Irish Republic" flag flew - it's on the near top corner of the GPO. (At least, that's what I read somewhere years ago!)

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: And the best preserved building in the photo is the one that was the centre of attention?  Probably gutted inside but more or less intact outside.
